original_title: Sri Lanka to set Advance Level exam date by law: President
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka will set the date for Advanced Level examination (high school certificate giving university entrance) by law President Ranil Wickremesinghe has told an expert committee tasked with coming up with an education framework.
A ministerial committee and an associated expert committee are to come up with strategies to make Sri Lanka a regional education hub. Children will get 13 years of schooling.

The holding of the A/L exam on a set date is to be made into a legal requirement and to change the date, permission had to be sought from the parliament, President Wickremesinghe was quoted as saying the education committee.
A decision also has to be taken on the need of the Grade 05 and Grade 10 exams, he had said.
Human resources are playing an important role in economic development, President Wickremsinghe has said. (Colombo/June15/2023)
